intro: Gompholobium laxum, commonly known as the slender gompholobium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its narrow, compound leaves and yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It plays a role in nitrogen fixation, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
